sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: STANISLAU, (Pol. Stanislavoff), the chief town in the district of the same name in Galicia, Austria, on the Albrecht and Lemberg-Czernowitz railways, in 49° 4' N. lat., 24° 30' E. long., has two real-schools, a gymnasium, and large ironworks. It has also a good trade in corn. The population (1885) numbers 18,626.
